items.content_html: I really like how my desk setup is coming along at my work loft space. Today I got my BookArc m√∂d installed and it really opens up the workspace. And the single cable connection to the TS3Plus dock is a huge win.
Are there any free or inexpensive image search APIs out there? I used to use the Bing Marketplace v1 one a couple years ago but that‚Äôs not around anymore.
Maybe it‚Äôs me, but over the past few years I‚Äôve found Deftones records to be simply wonderful music to work to.
Today I broke out he lawn mower for the first time this year. I‚Äôm so happy to have both a relatively small yard and an electric mower to mow it with.
YES!!! The BookArc m√∂d got updated to work with the TouchBar MacBook Pro!
Martini follow-up: tasty but strong. We are really feeling them!
Tonight‚Äôs mixology experiment: sweet martinis. My first attempt at a martini. Got this recipe and they turned out pretty well!
Over the weekend I took what may be my favorite iPhone camera picture to date.

I really liked the discussion on this week‚Äôs Fatal Error about impostor syndrome. I deal with this constantly as a newer part of an iOS team that has many way smarter and more experienced people than me.
New post from jsorge.net: Xcoders Talk: Practical Coordinators

The open web is really cool. I just set up a Zapier hook to add a micro.blog post whenever I post something new to my site. And I‚Äôve got a new post coming in the morning so it will be tested out shortly!
I‚Äôve been feeling a ton of pain debugging Notification Service extensions. Banging my head against the wall again and again.

It‚Äôs a weird feeling when you learn about someone‚Äôs death from your weather app, but because the app has an evil AI you go to Wikipedia to confirm that Alan Thicke really is dead. Of course that AI could have also hacked Wikipedia too. Thanks @CARROT_app!

I learned about a really cool new app today, and decided to write about it.

I really should write about small stuff more.
I turned off Dock badging on Slack and I‚Äôm feeling much happier now.
Ugh. I hate that Google Meet requires Chrome and doesn‚Äôt work on Safari. Are we really going to go back to the proprietary IE 6 days???

items.title: Hamilton!

items.content_html:
We are at the Paramount seeing Hamilton. But I almost didn‚Äôt get to.

When we got to the theater only one ticket was in my pocket. So we walked back to the van to behold our other one on the ground behind the van in the garage. Thank God it was still there. That was terrifying.
If there‚Äôs a sazerac recipe you enjoy, I‚Äôd love to hear about it ü•É
My kingdom for a way to import Markdown into a properly-rendered Google Doc.
I won the Pearl Jam drawing for the Seattle shows on both 8/8 and 8/10! I‚Äôm so excited to see them this summer.
Got registered for the Pearl Jam home show ticket lottery. Really hoping we can get tickets on Monday!

Interesting behavior in @manton‚Äôs new Sunlit. I wasn‚Äôt expecting a story to equate to a blog post that gets updated. Feels like a Sunlit story‚Äôs entries should each be a micro.blog post. It‚Äôs a fun app though and I‚Äôm excited to see where it goes from here.

I really love it when stuff I‚Äôm trying to figure out just starts to click. I‚Äôm also a little bit embarrassed when it‚Äôs stuff that I feel like either I should have known about, or ‚Äúsomeone in my position would have known about it‚Äù. Hello imposter syndrome.
I decided last week to figure out how to get all of my commits to be Verified like they are on GitHub. It was actually pretty easy once I found this helpful blog post to guide me! Thanks Aaron!
